alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cherokee County through 700 PM CDT... At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Forney, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Forney, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Fullerton, Chesnut Bay Resort, Howells Crossroads and Waterhouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
